arts.ttl: European round-up: Atletico Madrid extend win streak
arts.sum: Sebastiano Esposito’s double and further goals from Liberato Cacace and early substitute Lorenzo Colombo either side of Casper Tengstedt’s consolation saw Empoli win 4-1 at lowly Verona, with the scoring completed by half-time. However, Griezmann reduced the deficit before substitute Samuel Lino set up a grandstand finish during which the 33-year-old former France international scored the winner four minutes into stoppage time.

arts.ttl: Atlético 4-3 Sevilla (8 de Dic., 2024) Resultado Final

arts.ttl: Griezmann double makes it nine wins in a row for Atletico after stunning 4-3 victory over Sevilla
arts.sum: Atletico Madrid conceded three goals in a Spanish league game for the first time this season but still managed to beat Sevilla 4-3 on Sunday with Antoine Griezmann’s double helping to make it nine wins in a row for Diego Simeone’s in-form side. Third-place Madrid restored its three-point lead over fourth-place Athletic Bilbao, which beat Villarreal earlier Sunday.

arts.ttl: Antoine Griezmann earns Atletico Madrid last-gasp win over Sevilla
arts.sum: The hosts hit back from 3-1 down to win.

arts.ttl: Player Ratings: Atlético stun Sevilla with some late Metropolitano magic
arts.sum: Let down by his defense again as Sevilla took the lead on 32 minutes, as Isaac Romero blew past José Giménez to score a crisp goal — though Oblak did get a hand to the shot and could have saved it with better positioning. Couldn’t do a whole lot on Dodi Lukébakio’s 12th-minute equalizer, a rocket from the edge of the Atlético Madrid box after poor defending from a Sevilla set piece.

arts.ttl: View from the Fondo Sur: Antoine Griezmann is more clinical than ever
arts.sum: For the fourth game in a row, Antoine Griezmann got himself on the scoresheet as the hero to win the game for Atlético Madrid against Sevilla. Taking a look at his shot map below, we see that fewer of Griezmann’s attempts are coming in and around the six-yard box, but he’s arriving later, from deeper, and cutting through clinically.

arts.ttl: European football: Atlético stun Sevilla as Griezmann settles seven-goal thriller
arts.sum: France attacker scores injury-time goal for 4-3 win Napoli miss chance to return to top with Lazio loss A second-half double from Antoine Griezmann earned Atlético Madrid a stunning 4-3 comeback home win over Sevilla in La Liga on Sunday, as the hosts claimed their ninth straight win in all competitions. Atlético made a dominant start at home, with Griezmann hitting the crossbar before Rodrigo De Paul opened the scoring in the 10th minute, hammering a rocket from the edge of the box and into the top corner. Dodi Lukebakio equalised just two minutes later with a powerful low strike following a corner before Isaac Romero put Sevilla ahead after a quick counterattack in the 32nd minute, shooting across Jan Oblak, who could only get a finger to the ball. Continue reading...
